Blog > Update

How to Upgrade to PHP 8.4 in Laragon (Step-by-Step)

Leo Khoa
Jan 15, 2025
1 mins read

PHP 8.4 brings massive performance improvements and new features like property hooks. Laragon makes it incredibly easy to switch PHP versions without touching system environment variables. Here is how to do it in 3 minutes.

Step 1: Download PHP 8.4

First, you need to download the PHP binary for Windows. Since Laragon uses Apache, we usually need the Thread Safe (TS) version, but Laragon handles Non-Thread Safe (NTS) well too with FastCGI. For best compatibility, let's grab the VS17 x64 Thread Safe zip.

Step 2: Extract to Laragon

Locate your Laragon installation folder (usually C:\Laragon).

Step 3: Select Version

Open Laragon interface. Go to Menu > PHP > Version and select the new 8.4 version. Laragon will automatically restart Apache to apply changes.

Note: If you don't see the new version, try Stop â†’ Start again.
